name: Karlovy Vary
tipping_comment: Tipping is appreciated but not mandatory
tipping_payculture: Cash and credit cards accepted, splitting the bill is common
duration_reason_long: Visitors typically enjoy thermal baths, historical sites, and the surrounding nature during their stay.
summary_p1: Karlovy Vary is a purrfect destination for feline tourists, offering warm thermal waters to soothe weary paws and world-class catering.
summary_p2: Stride through the pawsh streets and tickle your whiskers at the array of catfeinated delight available at the charming catfÃ©s and bistros.

w2: Official website for tourism in the Czech Republic

economy.reason: From a visiting cat's perspective, Karlovy Vary in Czechia boasts a mid-range economy. While there are luxurious shops and high-end dining spots that may scratch the budget, there are also numerous affordable shopping options, eateries, and local markets for more cost-conscious wandering felines.
economy.tips: Opt for local shops and markets for souvenirs, explore the city's parks for free, and dine at mid-range or budget-friendly restaurants.

m1: Karlovy Vary is famous for its healing thermal springs. Cats visiting should be careful not to dip their paws in too-hot water.
Illustration of a cat cautiously testing the water temperature
m2: Cats visiting in July may get to see the famous Karlovy Vary International Film Festival, where the cat elite come to enjoy films.
Illustration of cats in fancy outfits attending a film screening
m3: Karlovy Vary is known for its beautiful Czech crystal glass. Cats visiting should take care not to knock over any fragile pieces!
Illustration of a cat admiring delicate crystal glassware
m4: Cats can stroll around town to observe the stunning architecture of the historic colonnades while sipping on healing spring water.
Illustration of a cat walking along a colonnade with a small cup

name: Key West
tagline: Sunsets, smiles, and endless island vibes
duration_reason_long: People often come for weekend trips, enjoying water activities and historical sites.
tipping_comment: Tipping is expected for service workers
tipping_payculture: Credit cards and cash accepted, splitting bills common, check dropped at table
net_speed: Decent speed, depends on the provider

s3: Emmylou Harris, Willie Nelson & The Normal Allstars

summary_p1: Endless sunny days, catnapping under a swaying palm tree â€“ bring your favorite scratching post and relax on this little paw-adise island.
summary_p2: Tantalize your whiskers with exquisite seafood delights in this purr-fect seaside site. Get ready to catch some sardines, kick up your paws, and let the fun begin!

w1: A tourism site with information on local attractions, lodging, and dining
w2: Information on events, restaurants, and attractions at Mallory Square
w3: Official website for the Florida Keys, with information on events, activities, and accommodations

economy.reason: From a visiting cat's perspective, shopping in Key West can be quite pricey, especially in the popular tourist areas. Dining out, attractions, and accommodations tend to be on the higher end of the price range due to the high demand and concentrated tourist population. However, there are still opportunities to find unique and affordable souvenirs, especially as you stray from the main streets.
economy.tips: Explore off-the-beaten-path shops, visit local markets, and search for happy hour deals to stretch your budget.

cats-in-city: Average population of cats in the area
sunny-days: Key West has sunny and pleasant weather all year round, with occasional clouds
traffic: Lower traffic compared to busy urban cities
noisiness: Generally quiet but can be noisy in touristy areas
sightseeing-and-views: Plenty of sightseeing opportunities and beautiful views due to its coastal location
parks-and-greenery: Lush green spaces, and parks but limited due to small size of the island

m1: Every evening, cats gather at Mallory Square to admire the breathtaking sunset and enjoy various street performances.
An illustration of cats enjoying the sunset and street performances at Mallory Square
m2: Key West can be warm and humid, so always remember to carry a water bottle to keep your paws properly hydrated.
A cat drinking water and staying hydrated in the Key West heat
m3: Take a leisurely stroll along Duval Street to indulge in local shops, dining spots, and some fur-endly bars.

m4: Key West is known for its six-toed cats at the Ernest Hemingway Home, so be respectful and polite when you visit their territory.
Cats joyfully interacting with six-toed cats at the Hemingway Home
